2 Binomial A Bernoulli random variable has only two possible values: 1 and 0, with probabilities p and 1-p, respectively. \[ P(X=x)=p(x)= \begin{cases} p^x(1-p)^{1-x}, \text{if x=0 or x=1}\\ 0, \text{otherwise}\\ \end{cases}\\ EX = p \\ VarX = p(1-p) \] The binomial distribution Suppose there are n identical, independent Bernoulli random variables: X1…Xn. Each \(X_i\) has probability p of being 1.
